ovdesc.p: to generate MT509 manually/automatically and MT549 (for requesting a MT576 message)

desc.p: This field will accept a valid SEC.OPEN.ORDER reference if 509 is inputted in SEND.MSG field. This field will not allow any value if TRADE.REF is input.
Valid record in SP.ORDER.STP.ACTIVITY file
Current time will be defaulted
It can also be changed
This field forms associated multivalue set along with REASON.CODE and is used to hold description of the assoicated reason code
Input allowed only for MT509
This field will accept a valid SEC.TRADE reference if 509 is inputted in SEND.MSG field. This field will not allow any value if ORD.EXE.REF is input
Holds the message type that will be sent
Record should exist in DE.MESSAGE file
Input should be only MT509 and MT549
This field will allow the following codes MACH_NMAT_AFFI_NAFI. If STATUS.QUALIFIER is set to :MTCH then code MACH/NMAT will be allowed as input.
For :AFFM AFFI or NAFI code will be allowed as input.
For :CPRC, CANP will allowed as input
For :RPRC, DAND will allowed as input
Mandatory input if STATUS.QUALIFIER is input with a value and if SEND.MSG is 509
Current date will be defaulted
It can also be changed
Valid Date format
A key to the record that will be auto generated.
This field will allow the following options
: MTCH
: AFFM
: CPRC
: RPRC
This field is used to describe the status of message being sent.
Valid SWIFT qualifier
The Receiver of the message will be input in this field. This field will allow a valid CUSTOMER. SECURITY record of a BROKER
Valid record on CUSTOMER. SECURITY and BROKER. TYPE should be BROKER
This field will hold the value if MT509 is sent as rejection and will hold the reason codes for rejection
This field will allow input if STATUS.CODE is set to NMAT or NAFI.
Should be valid record on SP.REASON.CODE file
Mandatory input if STATUS.CODE is NMAT or NAFI
Input allowed only for MT509

When an inward MT509/MT576 is received for a previously sent query, this field will be populated with the senders reference. The sender's reference from an inward message will be recorded in this field. For rejection MT509 this field will be populated with the senders reference in MT513/MT515
This field holds the delivery reference
This field will hold delivery reference of MT509, MT513 and MT515
This field will allow option 576_502_513_515.
This field will accept 576 if SEND.MSG is 549 otherwise it accepts 502 513 or 515 depending upon the fields STATUS.QUALIFIER, ORD.EXE.REF and TRADE.REF.
If STATUS.QUALIFIER is: CPRC or: RPRC then this field will hold 502.
If STATUS.QUALIFIER is: MTCH or: AFFM then this field will hold 513 if ORD.EXE.REF is inputted.
If STATUS.QUALIFIER is: MTCH or: AFFM then this field will hold 515 if TRADE.REF is inputted.
Valid record in DE.MESSAGE file
